name: Snowfall
description:
THIS IS A VERY EARLY WORK IN PROGRESS.

I don't normally make games like this, and I also don't normally write these descriptions in the first person, but whatever. I live in Connecticut, a place that gets a reasonable amount of snow, and while I'll never like shoveling, I do quite enjoy the feeling of a strong snowstorm, so I built a game to try and capture the feeling of being out in a snowstorm.

If you really like this idea, and want to support me in continuing development, feel free to chip in a little when you download the game. Even if you don't, thanks for taking the time to play my silly experiment.

Sounds I used:

Wind

Footsteps

BUILD 3 CHANGELOG

  • Removed physics from trees (temporary fix util I figure out a better way of optimizing physics performance)
  • forest is now infinite (or until you run out of memory)
  • Slight tweaks to physics and movement
  • Trees now spawn with random size variations
